page.title: 20ECOLOGY OF CASTLETON
page.content: The area is underlain by Carboniferous Limestone in the south,Edale Shales in the centre and Gritstone to the north the geology had dramatically influenced the landscape, which comprisises a wide steep-sided valley with a dramatic limestone gorge (Winnats) to the west. Plants and animals relate to the underlying geology and past and present landscapes.To the south is limestone grassland with pocketsof remant ash woodland; in the north is more intensively farmed,resulting in mostly open habitats including hayfields, marshy areas and streams. The area is criss crossed with well posted public footpaths and rights of way which are much used by visitors.The National Park rangers patrol the area and maintain the footpaths and signs.
